location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from S? Malcolm, Bushire to Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: The item was originally foliatedas 85-86 as a folded letter, these numbers have been crossed through and replaced with a single foliation number of 85 in the top right corner to reflect the letter's original use as a single sheet.

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the news of Pelly's health and local matters relative to Bushire including:Orders from the Commissioner in Sind regarding charges for the shipping of opium from Kurrachee [Karachi] and enquiring whether the charges would apply if an opium cargo was aboard a ship passing through Kurrachee but which was not landed or transhipped.The arrival of the S S Mesopotamiawhich had brought goods for Messrs Gray Paul and themselves.The recent weather, including temperature and barometer readings.Ministerial changes in Persia.The letter also refers to an enclosed letter to Mr (Charles) Alison, which is not present.
